title: Missing Security Headers - XSS Protection Disabled on /xss25
description: The /xss25 endpoint returns an X-XSS-Protection header explicitly set to 0, which disables XSS protections in older browsers. Additionally, critical security headers are missing: 1) X-Content-Type-Options (should be 'nosniff' to prevent MIME type sniffing), 2) X-Frame-Options (should be 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN' to prevent clickjacking), 3) Content-Security-Policy (should restrict inline scripts and control script sources), 4) Strict-Transport-Security (recommended for HTTPS to prevent downgrade attacks). These headers provide defense-in-depth protection against various web vulnerabilities including XSS, clickjacking, MIME sniffing, and protocol downgrade attacks.
impact: Without these security headers: 1) Browser-based XSS filters are disabled, removing a defense layer in legacy browsers, 2) MIME type sniffing attacks become possible, allowing browsers to execute content as script/style regardless of Content-Type, 3) Clickjacking attacks can frame the page and trick users into unintended actions, 4) Inline scripts can execute without restriction due to missing CSP, 5) Man-in-the-middle attacks possible on HTTPS without HSTS. This significantly reduces the defense-in-depth security posture of the application on this endpoint.
evidence:
HTTP GET request to http://localhost:5000/xss25 returns:
- X-XSS-Protection: 0 (explicitly disabled - vulnerable)
- Missing: X-Content-Type-Options header
- Missing: X-Frame-Options header
- Missing: Content-Security-Policy header
- Missing: Strict-Transport-Security header

POC execution verified these findings by directly inspecting response headers. The endpoint only returns basic headers (Content-Type, Content-Length, Server, Date, X-XSS-Protection) without any additional security headers.
remediation: Add the following HTTP response headers to the /xss25 endpoint (and preferably all endpoints): 1) X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff - Prevents MIME type sniffing, 2) X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN - Prevents clickjacking while allowing same-origin framing, 3) X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block - Enables browser XSS protection in legacy browsers, 4) Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' - Restricts script execution and prevents inline scripts, 5) Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains - Enforces HTTPS (if using HTTPS). Implement these using security middleware (e.g., Flask-Talisman) to set headers consistently across all endpoints.
references: OWASP A05:2021 - Security Misconfiguration, CWE-693: Protection Mechanism Failure, CWE-79: Cross-site Scripting, CWE-451: User Interface (UI) Misrepresentation of Critical Information
toolCallDescription: Document missing security headers vulnerability on /xss25 endpoint with verified POC
